task.summary: Default task
1.1 Markers -> Model + Migration Articles -> Model + Migration + Resource Controller, tested routing
1.1 Markers -> Model + Migration Articles -> Model + Migration + Resource Controller, tested routing Updated Read.me File

1.1.01 Minor changes to migration files Added index route to articles resource Played with views integrations. Worked on views, remember how it worked, fiddled with layout filed, yields and extends, simple POST form to /articles/create -> must add validation and db integration on future version

1.2 Renamed Articles to Products for better understanding Made Index and Create view, as well as main functionalities for the ProductController -> to be added: Update, Delete & Show Chiseled Product Model, added new public function "owner" to quickly find the owner of every product

1.2 Renamed Articles to Products for better understanding Made Index and Create view, as well as main functionalities for the ProductController -> to be added: Update, Delete & Show Chiseled Product Model, added new public function "owner" to quickly find the owner of every product Switched main Laravel.mix (webpack) to compile React for future Front-End development & integration
1.2.01 Finished ProductsContoller Core, to be added: user validation ( auth middleware ) Finished routes for Products ( basic models, front-end is yet to be developed )

1.3 Adds: - Models: Sales, Tags - Migrations: sale, tags, pivot_products_tags - Factories: Product, Sales - Controllers: Sales - Routes: sales(index+store - get+post)
Updates: - foreign keys - public functions to all models for easier db querying - updates to project + user structure data
To be added: - authorization security to limit acces - event + notification on sale dispatch - future possible db queries - front-end?

1.3 Adds: - Models: Sales, Tags - Migrations: sale, tags, pivot_products_tags - Factories: Product, Sales - Controllers: Sales - Routes: sales(index+store - get+post)
Updates: - foreign keys - public functions to all models for easier db querying - updates to project + user structure data
To be added: - authorization security to limit acces - event + notification on sale dispatch - future possible db queries - front-end?
Security: - updated security dependency

2.0 Big Update - Switched from client side application to api
Adds: - Added OAuth 2.0 functionalities: Client, Grants, etc. ( users can now make requests to certain endpoints by only exposing the implicit access token that was given to them - Users will now be notified when a new Sale is instantiated, receiving a confirmation email to allow access for further sale finalization - DB Seeders for the Tags and Counties tables; will now be populated as soon as the server starts using 'php artisan db:seed' - Added a new County Model for referencing all Products/Users in a certain location, better filtering - Added the Laravel-Cors library so that the app won't return a Cors Policy error - Added new columns for the following tables: users, products; to represent more valuable data
Updates: - rearranged migrations to match the correct order of the table creation process - included foreign keys for the counties table, will now work properly - most routes now return json instead of returning a view ( more to be updated ) - so that the application can be used as a porper API

2.1 Update
Adds: - Added Encryptable Trait to Users Model, Application is now GDPR Compliant, as no user personal-info is kept unencrypted in the database. This is a huge Security Update, as the new rules of the European Comission are now being followed by our application. We aknowledge the importance of privacy and accept no mistakes from our part.
Updates: - Users and Products now accept an image trait, which is stored as an base64 encrypted value in the DataBase

2.1.01 Update
Updates: - Products now return with tags implemented

2.1.02 Update
Updates: - All Products now return with tags implemented

2.1.03 Update
Updates: - Products Model has now a max_quantity attribute - Sales Controller now reacts better to the initializations of sales

2.1.04 Update
Updates: - Users Model now has an additional UsersController which is used to return the logged-in users products for the "My Products page"

2.2 Functional Update The server API is complete. All functionalities work and the app seems complete. Might add future Email Verification, but as of now it's unnecessary. Minor tweaks might follow
Added: - Cart: Model, Controller, Migrations The cart is now stored in the database. When a user logs out and reenters his products won't be lost. The Cart Model provides a number of functionalities and stands as the base for every Order - Notifications: OrderDenial/Confirmation, VerifyEmail(Draft), NewOrder The notifications have been revamped to act as they should, being sent after certain actions take place on the server. The use of Events and Listerners seemed redundant for this project and thus the lack of them. However, future support is available. Future support for notifications through the database is also possible but as of now redundant. Email views are much prettier - Auth: Forgot/ResetPassword A user can now request to reset his/her password if forgotten, this has been done through the overwriting of existing Laravel commands - Views: Email Sent emails now have been revamped with the use of appropriate html files, together with blade file help
Changes: - The old "Sale" Model has now been renamed to Order to better illustrate what it does. All adherent files have also been refactored. - The new Order model functions on the base of the Cart model. When a new order is initiated, all the items from the users cart get transported into the new Order. The products are also divided by their sellers. A new Order is created for each seller and every seller gets an email notification. Orders can be confirmed or denied by the seller and later unvalidated in case the deal falls off.
Updates: - Products now have a sold_out column to better sort out which products are still available on the market - User Model now comes in with more functions - new routes introduced to the api.php file

2.2 Functional Update The server API is complete. All functionalities work and the app seems complete. Might add future Email Verification, but as of now it's unnecessary. Minor tweaks might follow
Added: - Cart: Model, Controller, Migrations The cart is now stored in the database. When a user logs out and reenters his products won't be lost. The Cart Model provides a number of functionalities and stands as the base for every Order - Notifications: OrderDenial/Confirmation, VerifyEmail(Draft), NewOrder The notifications have been revamped to act as they should, being sent after certain actions take place on the server. The use of Events and Listerners seemed redundant for this project and thus the lack of them. However, future support is available. Future support for notifications through the database is also possible but as of now redundant. Email views are much prettier - Auth: Forgot/ResetPassword A user can now request to reset his/her password if forgotten, this has been done through the overwriting of existing Laravel commands - Views: Email Sent emails now have been revamped with the use of appropriate html files, together with blade file help
Changes: - The old "Sale" Model has now been renamed to Order to better illustrate what it does. All adherent files have also been refactored. - The new Order model functions on the base of the Cart model. When a new order is initiated, all the items from the users cart get transported into the new Order. The products are also divided by their sellers. A new Order is created for each seller and every seller gets an email notification. Orders can be confirmed or denied by the seller and later unvalidated in case the deal falls off.
Updates: - Products now have a sold_out column to better sort out which products are still available on the market - User Model now comes in with more functions - new routes introduced to the api.php file

2.2.01 Minor Update
Added: - users now have a phone-number tag; that has been included in the confirmation email aswell

2.2.02 Bug Fixing
Fixed: - minor Case-Sensitive bug on sending notifications - removed web routes

2.2.03 Small Updates
Updates: - added new tags - searching for a tag with no products now return empty array - fixed a link in a mail

2.2.04 Small Updates
Updates: - Order show more informations

2.2.04 Small Updates
Updates: - Order show more informations + added route

2.2.05 Small Updates
Updates: - Added Route that returns orders where the user is a seller

2.2.06 Small Updates
Updates: - Mail updates, fixed links and instagram reference

2.2.07 Logic update
Updates: - Validations now have a different logic to them

2.2.08 Bug Fixing
Bugs: - OrderController had duplicate validate() function declared; - Logout now revokes only the current token

2.2.08 Bug Fixing
Bugs: - OrderController had duplicate validate() function declared; - Logout now revokes only the current token - Added missing import

2.2.10 Bug Fix:
Duplicate validation entry in OrderController
